'' for an executive who is transitioning out of the CEO role- and may even be unusual for sitting CEOs, said David Wise , senior principal at management consulting firm Hay Group. But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. `` It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat,'' David Wise said. Eric Schmidt , 55, is being replaced as chief executive by co-founder Larry Page , 37.

Michael Arrington , who wrote that his blog was about to break the story about Eric Schmidt being tired and wanting out last summer. An interview with the three Google leaders convinced him to hold off, Michael Arrington wrote. Google insisted the story wasn't accurate, wasn't even close to accurate, and generally contained no accuracy whatsoever, Michael Arrington wrote.`` We killed the story, since their denials seemed fairly straightforward and honest, and we found no other independent sources.''
